intent_atoms.description: FoundationUI design tokens must be used exclusively in all view files; hardcoded .accentColor and manual opacity values are disallowed.
As a developer, I want to migrate ISOInspectorApp’s color usage from hardcoded values to FoundationUI design tokens so that the app follows the centralized design system.

All affected view files (ParseTreeOutlineView.swift, ParseTreeDetailView.swift, ValidationSettingsView.swift, IntegritySummaryView.swift, ISOInspectorAppTheme.swift) must reference DS.* tokens for color and opacity; no hardcoded .accentColor or manual opacity remains.
Licensing approvals for Dolby Vision, AV1, VP9, Dolby AC-4, and MPEG-H fixtures must be obtained before importing assets and updating regression baselines.
As a QA engineer, I want to import licensed media assets and refresh regression baselines so that tolerant parsing and export scenarios can validate against real-world payloads.
Licensed assets are imported and regression baselines are refreshed; tests pass against the new payloads.
macOS hardware with 1 GiB performance fixture must be available before running the lenient‑vs‑strict benchmark.
As a performance engineer, I want to execute the macOS 1 GiB benchmark and collect runtime and RSS metrics so that we can publish them in Documentation/Performance.
Benchmark runs with ISOINSPECTOR_BENCHMARK_PAYLOAD_BYTES=1073741824 produce runtime and RSS metrics; the results are archived …

functional_units.name: Design System Color Token Migration
functional_units.description: Migrates hardcoded accent colors and opacity values in view files to use FoundationUI design tokens (DS.*) for consistency.

functional_units.name: Real-World Assets Acquisition
functional_units.description: Imports licensed media assets (Dolby Vision, AV1, VP9, Dolby AC-4, MPEG-H) and refreshes regression baselines for tolerant parsing and export scenarios.

functional_units.name: macOS Benchmark Execution
functional_units.description: Runs a 1 GiB lenient‑vs‑strict benchmark on macOS, collects runtime and RSS metrics, and archives results in Documentation/Performance.

functional_units.name: FoundationUI Performance Profiling with Instruments
functional_units.description: Manually profiles rendering, memory, and animation performance using Xcode Instruments across iOS 17 and macOS 14 devices to meet target thresholds.

functional_units.name: FoundationUI Performance Benchmarks
functional_units.description: Measures build time, binary size, memory footprint, FPS, and large‑node tree performance across platforms, documenting baseline metrics.

functional_units.name: Cross-Platform Testing
functional_units.description: Manually tests ComponentTestApp on iOS, macOS, and iPadOS devices/simulators for UI consistency, dark mode, RTL, locale, and orientation.

functional_units.name: Manual Accessibility Testing
functional_units.description: Verifies VoiceOver, keyboard navigation, dynamic type, contrast, and other accessibility features across iOS and macOS to achieve final sign‑off.
